Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of goat (tail, rump and parts of hind legs remaining) to right; pendant roundel, elaborate cross, concentric circles ringed with inverted TT (part) as filling ornament. Graffito on inside.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 75, p. 252, no. 387, pl. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0372) (phase 2)
